pullRequest.title: BXMSPROD-944 GA build-chain pull-request flow
pullRequest.bodyText:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/BXMSPROD-944
related PRs:

kiegroup/kogito-apps#535
kiegroup/kogito-examples#452
#887
kiegroup/kogito-pipelines#158

Many thanks for submitting your Pull Request ❤️!
Please make sure that your PR meets the following requirements:

 You have read the contributors guide
 Pull Request title is properly formatted: KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request title contains the target branch if not targeting master: [0.9.x] KOGITO-XYZ Subject
 Pull Request contains link to the JIRA issue
 Pull Request contains link to any dependent or related Pull Request
 Pull Request contains description of the issue
 Pull Request does not include fixes for issues other than the main ticket

nodes.bodyText: maybe we don't need this extension as here we don't use parallel builds at all
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@
+name: Build Chain Full Downstream
+
+on: [pull_request]
+
+jobs:
+  build-chain:
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]
+        java-version: [11]
+      fail-fast: false
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    name: Maven Build
+    steps:
+      - name: Set up JDK
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: ${{ matrix.java-version }}
+      - name: Install takari (non-windows)
+        if: ${{ matrix.os != 'windows-latest' }}
+        run: |
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/aether/takari-local-repository/0.11.3/takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/takari-filemanager/0.8.3/takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar
+          wget -P $M2_HOME/lib/ext https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/maven/takari-smart-builder/0.6.1/takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar
+      - name: Install takari (windows)
+        if: ${{ matrix.os == 'windows-latest' }}
+        run: |
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/aether/takari-local-repository/0.11.3/takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-local-repository-0.11.3.jar")
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/takari-filemanager/0.8.3/takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-filemanager-0.8.3.jar")
+          (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/io/takari/maven/takari-smart-builder/0.6.1/takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar", "$Env:M2_HOME\lib\ext\takari-smart-builder-0.6.1.jar")

nodes.bodyText: Tooling, images and operator has a different CI configuration and the build is probably neither maven based so please remove them from here and close corresponding PRs ( kiegroup/kogito-images#281 kiegroup/kogito-operator#653 )
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+version: "2.0"
+dependencies:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    mapping:
+      dependencies:
+        default:
+          source: stable
+          target: master
+      source: master
+      target: stable
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-tooling
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-cloud-operator
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples

nodes.bodyText: I would add that project dependencies should be defined in each project, not all in one place for readability of the CI in a project ...
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+version: "2.0"
+dependencies:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    mapping:
+      dependencies:
+        default:
+          source: stable
+          target: master
+      source: master
+      target: stable
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-tooling
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-cloud-operator
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-images
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples

nodes.bodyText: Can't those command be defined in each project ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+version: "2.0"
+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+      current: |
+        mvn clean install -Prun-code-coverage -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn validate -Psonarcloud-analysis -e -nsu -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn clean install -Pintegration-tests -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps

nodes.bodyText: In general I would say that kogito-examples also depends on kogito-apps. I don't know if this is very true now but I would not prevent the creation of examples with components from -apps
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+version: "2.0"
+dependencies:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-apps
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-examples
+    dependencies:
+      - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes

nodes.bodyText:
In existing Jenkinsfile we use different folders to execute the different commands. Is this equivalent?
@radtriste to be honest I don't remember why we use different folders. Do you?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,29 @@
+version: "2.0"
+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+      current: |
+        mvn clean install -Prun-code-coverage -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn validate -Psonarcloud-analysis -e -nsu -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn clean install -Pintegration-tests -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3

nodes.bodyText: In kogito we usually always build and test all three repos. Can you please remove this workflow and change all pull-request files as full-downstream flow-type?
What about make it possible to run it with a "Jenkins retest this" comment cause most people are already used to that?

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
          
          
            
                    mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3 -DskipTests
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,39 @@
+version: "2.0"
+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  current: mvn -e clean install -nsu -Prun-code-coverage,wildfly -Dfull  -Dintegration-tests=true -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
          
          
            
                  current: mvn -e clean install -nsu -Prun-code-coverage,wildfly -Dfull  -Dintegration-tests=false -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,39 @@
+version: "2.0"
+
+dependencies: ./project-dependencies.yaml
+
+build:
+  - project: kiegroup/kogito-runtimes
+    build-command:
+      upstream: |
+        mvn clean install -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+      current: |
+        mvn clean install -Prun-code-coverage -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn validate -Psonarcloud-analysis -Dsonar.login=$SONAR_TOKEN -e -nsu -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
+        mvn -f kogito-runtimes-integration-tests/pom.xml clean
+    clone:
+      - kogito-runtimes-integration-tests
+
+  - project: kiegroup/optaplanner
+    build-command:
+      current: mvn -e clean install -nsu -Prun-code-coverage,wildfly -Dfull  -Dintegration-tests=true -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  upstream: mvn -e clean install -DskipTests -Dgwt.compiler.skip=true -Dgwt.skipCompilation=true -Denforcer.skip=true -Dcheckstyle.skip=true -Dspotbugs.skip=true -Drevapi.skip=true -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3
          
          
            
                  upstream: mvn -e clean install -Dquickly -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=25 -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3

commit.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: Tristan Radisson <tristan.radisson@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Disabling those could be a problem or ?
